choices: It only takes a couple of minutes. All of you shrink here in the school.
Later that night. You shrink at home.
Tomorrow, you shrink at Atlas Park.
A week from now, you shrink while enjoying Atlas Beach.
1.content:
Late Spring, Summer's just around the corner. You, Nick Lewis, were working with a group of students in the science lab after school. It was Friday night, and normally you'd have a multitude of better things to do, but when a couple of pals in on the project told you what they were up to, it sounded too good to pass up.

You weren't one of the smarter teens there, so you were relegated to acting as an assistant, fetching tools and equipment and whatever those doing the actual science needed. Apparently, one of the guys there had a big ground-breaking scientist father who accidentally left some notes out on an interesting new serum.

Supposedly, according to the notes, pouring the concoction over human skin should cause the cells to bunch closer together, hardening the skin into its own near-bulletproof armor. Sean, the scientist's son, did his best to quickly copy as much of the notes down as he could, and collect some of the materials from home and smuggle them into school. It's a miracle he didn't get caught, and now here you all are.

All in all there's about twelve of you in on this. Sean told a friend, who told a friend or two, who told a friend, and so on until you got to where you are. Seven boys and five girls, all excited to see if everyone here can contribute to create this miracle serum.

What none of you knew, however, is that due to a large number of reasons, you all got the serum very, very wrong. Some of the notes were sloppily taken, some numbers were written incorrectly, some people couldn't quite read the handwriting correctly, someone got their math off, someone used the wrong temperature, someone didn't measure quite right. It was a perfect storm of mistakes to create an incredible, yet terrible outcome. If anyone had done just one more thing right or just one more thing wrong, it would have been a simple failure. But no, as if a higher power demanded it, you all screwed up just right.

In the final stages of creating the serum, the mixture got too heated and started to bubble and rattle the glass it was being heated in. Erin, one of the girls there, tried to quickly shut off the heat, but it was far too late.

CRACK

The glass exploded and mixture splashed over everyone. Everyone rushed to the emergency chemical showers, quickly rinsing off the mixture. But it was too late. The new serum, accidentally created by all of you, already soaked into your skin and began its work. Rather than hardening your skin, it would condense your cells and cause each and every one of you to shrink down to just a couple of inches tall.

But how fast-acting was your new serum? When and where do you, Nick Lewis, shrink?
1.title: Atlas City Stories

choices: You look for any other students that may have stayed after to get their help.
You search for a food source, so you can last until Monday when school is back.
You all decide to venture outside, you can't stay in the school all weekend.
No one is composed enough to work together. You go separate ways.
You were mistaken! Laura wasn't in the room when it blew, she returns to the lab
11.content:
Sean, Vanessa, Will, Briana, Rob, Jennifer, John, Laura, Eric, Tiffany, David, you.

Twelve Hyperion students meddling in what they didn't understand and never should have. All twelve were good students with a path to potentially successful futures.

But now? All of that is likely gone. Not even ten minutes after being coated in the dastardly liquid, all twelve students fell to the ground and passed out, as their bodies reacted strangely to the serum. Condensing, condensing, condensing. More importantly, shrinking, shrinking, shrinking. Their bodies dwindled in size. Soon they were all very tiny, just a couple of inches tall. Nothing compared to their previous heights, even the shortest among them (Laura at 5'1", if you're curious).

When you, Nick Lewis, woke up, you were in shock and awe of your surroundings. Everything was massive. Except you. And your classmates. When the rest woke up, some were too in shock to speak. Some cried. Some were amazing and excited at what had happened. You didn't know how to feel.

After some time, everyone collected their emotions enough to gather and speak.

You all started to deliberate on your plan.
11.title: Shrunk at Hyperion High

choices: She steps on and over the crowd
A new shadow approaches from behind... Her boyfriend.
111.content:
It didn't take long after you left the classroom before you started to hear some rhythmic earthquakes, as an impossible form strode into the corridor you were in. You all looked up in awe as a girl you all recognised made her presence known with earth shattering effect. Niamh.

The pale and lanky redhead was the biggest bitch in the school. A viscious, sadistic and nasty girl through and through, she's the most popular girl in the entire place. She couldn't see your tiny forms on the floor in front of her. Her gaze was straight forward as she nattered or rather thundered on the phone. Every step brought her feet, clad in knee high platform boots that could crush a tank to dust without their owner so much as noticing, thundering towards you.

People start to panic as it dawned on them that they were in trouble. Some began to bolt, others stayed frozen in fear. Niamh kept walking and walking...
111.title: Niamh, the Queen B

choices: Hope is dim, but is not gone
1111.content:
(Warning: I have never attempted to write anything gorey before, but this chapter does contain my attempt at writing that. So if gore of any kind is not your thing, maybe go read a different chapter instead)

Some of you were too scared to move.

Everyone is familiar with the phrase fight or flight. Meaning when faced with a threat, do you face it down or try to outrun it. But there is a lesser known third F.

Freeze.

Despite the phrase "Fight or flight" being so common, you'd be surprised at how many people actually fell under Freeze. It's a lot.

Out of all twelve of you, five of you were frozen in your tracks. Yourself included.

Your heart never pounded harder in your entire life as it did right now, as Niamh's massive boots pounded into the ground, sending tremors you felt in your very bones rattle your whole being. One would think it should be easy to see the pattern of her stride and predict exactly where her meteoric footfalls would land. But you're dealing with life an a whole new scale, and it's just impossible.

Your life really does flash before your eyes before it's ready to go. A flash is exactly what it is. When you hear that term, you think you'll see everything on fast forward really quickly. But in reality, it was a series of images, some people you cared about, some people you hated, your favorite video game, last Tuesday when you had spaghetti for dinner. It was just a quick series of images that passed by so fast you're not sure if it really happened. But the last one was Niamh's face, from an angle below you, since you're usually taller than her.

You see the dusty, ridged sole rise into the air and eclipse the sky. It's the most terrifying thing you've ever seen. Your life is over, and in the peak moment of terror you are simultaneously filled with a fear like no other that left you without the ability to scream, as well as the calm that washes over your very soul, knowing there's nothing you can do to change this moment.

And then it's over. The front of her sole is behind you. Her heel is in front of you. You were caught in the raised instep of her platform boot. Your life was spared. Your extremities go numb, as your brain has given up on trying to fully process the wave of physical signals your body has been launching its way.

You didn't even realize, but you had turned around to watch Niamh keep walking. You are numb to feeling for the moment, overwhelmed by your own cocktail of emotions exploding inside you. The numbness comes in handy.

Briana was frozen, like you. You see the exact moment the terror solidified in her eyes. The image of where she was standing was replaced with Niamh's platform boot. You heard a terrible sound, like a water balloon from the inside exploding from too much pressure, coupled with the sound of someone breaking an entire bundle of sticks in half at once.

It felt like an eternity passed between when you heard that sound and your brain processed what exactly it was. You only glanced at the spot where Briana stood for a split second. There was a lumpy pile of flesh there, surrounded by a massive pool of blood.

Niamh's footsteps did not falter or change pace in the slightest. She didn't even notice what she had done. She didn't have a clue that her following footsteps were leaving a red splotch on the tile with every placement of her right foot.

Freezing in the face of danger is not what killed Briana. Besides Niamh's boot, what actually killed Briana was the cruelty of fate, or the randomness and lack of caring of reality.

John ran, after all. John did not freeze like Briana, he fled. He saw the horror that was Briana's fate. He saw Niamh's approaching feet. He was already running, so he tried to get out of the way.

John's problem was not miscalculation. He successfully maneuvered himself out of the path of the boot that crushed Briana.

John's problem was distraction. He was so drawn to the liquefied remains of Briana stuck to the bottom of Niamh's boot, that while he successfully ran out of the path that that foot traveled, he had almost completely ignored the other one. From your perspective, it almost looked as if he tried to run underneath her left foot.

Needless to say, John fared no better against the careless saunter of the school's queen bee.

You remembered your life flashing before your eyes. What you do not remember is the moments between seeing John disappear and sitting on your hands and knees with a pool of your own vomit underneath you.

You were distracted from your pool of sick as the now-distant rhythmic footfalls stopped. You looked up and saw Niamh turn around and look down the hall in your general direction.

That's when the rest of your hearing kicked back in. Several of your other shrunken classmates were screaming and crying in absolute terror. You don't blame them. But you think it got Niamh's attention.

You watched her eyes focus on the two dark pools of blood, and then follow the splotchy trail that led to her. You could see her face wrinkle in confusion as she lifted her foot, grabbing it with her hand to get a better look at the underside.

"Gross," was all she had to say. She put her foot back down and started to look at the rest of you. You could barely make out her whispering, "What the fuck?"

She began to come back this way. It was like before, the thunderous tremors caused by her footsteps increasing as she drew near. She reached down and grabbed Sean up off the floor. He was somewhat far away, but you could still see the tears streaking down his face and his terrified expression as Niamh's delicate, pale fingers wrapped around his body and lifted him into the sky.

Niamh looked him over, and you saw her facial expression change. She was clearly still somewhat confused, but now she knew a bit more about what was going on here. She looked back at all of you, and made her way towards her next nearest classmate.

As she crouched down to snatch up David, the rest of you had begun to flee. Even those of you who were formerly frozen. You all ran in the opposite direction, hoping to hide or escape Niamh by any means necessary.

Currently, you, Sean, Vanessa, Will, Rob, Jennifer, Laura, Eric, Tiffany, and David are still alive.

Niamh has captured Sean and David.

The rest of you are running away.

Who escapes?

1. All of you escape. Niamh only manages to capture Sean and David, the rest of you found somewhere to hide. Once Niamh leaves, you re-gather to discuss what happened.

2. Several of you escape, but Niamh captures many of you. Whether you're among the captured or the escaped is up to you.

3. None of you escape. Niamh's stride is too big for you, she has an easy time catching up to and capturing each and every last one of you. You're all in her hands, now.
1111.title: Merciless Queen

11113.content:
You run for your life. The adrenaline surges through your body and forces you to go. You don't think you've ever run faster in all your years. For just a moment, you forget your terror. You just relish the feeling of running, all-out sprinting.

But that enjoyment is quashed within seconds. You can feel Niamh catching up. The tremors grow more intense very quickly, only stopping for a few moments here and there. And each time they stop, you can hear the yelling of one of your shrunken classmates.

You're already running faster than ever before in your life, but from the earthquakes you can tell it still isn't fast enough. You try to mentally channel your adrenaline to somehow make you faster. You try to pray that somehow you will suddenly gain a burst of speed and escape. You're currently between classrooms, so trying to duck into a doorway and hide isn't an option.

You run out of time to hope as a shadow stretches over you, and giant, pale, tree trunk-like fingers stretch out ahead of you and wrap around, closing in and sealing you in her grip.

You feel your stomach drop as it feels like you're launched into the air on a rocket ship. In reality, Niamh's just lifting her hand. In moments you're shoved into her other hand, with your other captured classmates. She has this hand, her right hand, pressed against the upper area of her stomach so that it's easier to hold so many of you. When looking up, instead of seeing her enormous face, instead you are shaded by the outcropping that is her breasts. They were pretty decent before, but seeing them above you, completely dwarfing you, even contained within her bra and shirt, makes you feel even smaller than before.

You were among the last that needed to be collected. Only two of you came after. You quickly did a head count, remembering to subtract Briana and John, and realized Niamh had you all.

Some of you were crying. Others had blank stares. And still yet, some of you peered over the edge of Niamh's hand, as if maybe you could survive the fall. You specifically, you were just watching everyone else. You were feeling the rhythmic sway as Niamh carried all of you. She carried you all back into the lab you had escaped from. The place of regret, where meddling with science you didn't understand changed your lives forever. And ended Briana and John's.

Niamh walked around the room, checking through cabinets. She eventually pulled out a bin, set it on one of the counters, and deposited you all inside.

She stood above you, looking down at all of you cowering in the bin. This is the closest you've been to her face where you could actually see it. You've always been used to being almost a foot taller than her, and looking down at her.

Of course, even before today that's all you had. While you were taller than Niamh and could look down at her in that regard, she won out in every other plane. On the popularity scale, you're like a B-, maybe a B. Not too shabby, but you're nothing compared to Niamh. She wasn't even an A+, she was the S Rank.

But now you've lost even that, as she towers over all of you. She was smiling now, maybe a bit excited. You hated to admit it, but she was pretty hot. It's not like you got to be the school's queen bee by not being a looker, after all.

"I have no idea how you losers wound up like this, but this is the craziest shit I've ever seen. Stay here while I clean up the mess you made," she said, her face turning to disgust as she says the last part. She walks away, and off in the distance you hear the ripping of paper towels.

"The mess we made?" Tiffany asks incredulously. "Mess?" she seethes. That mess is our friends! People!" Tiffany is beginning to hyperventilate. You quickly make your way over to her to try to calm her down.

"It's gonna be alright, we'll make it through this," you say to her quietly, while hugging her to you, as her tears begin to flow. You and her both know these are empty words, but it's not about whether it's true. It's just about the comforting nature of hearing it.

Niamh's back after a few minutes, still giddy about her find. She speaks down to all of you.

"So what'd you losers like, even do? I can't imagine it was on purpose, did you mess something up with a lab experiment in here? I cleaned up your mess by the way, you're welcome," she said, as if we were really supposed to be grateful for it. "I mean, I guess it would make sense if it were on purpose. There's no better cause then to give yourselves to me," she said, her eyes looking away and her hand gesturing at her, indicating she's clearly being facetious.

"So let's see here, there's..." she pauses to count all of you, "ten of you here. That's a lot of little people," she laughs. "Well, I guess there used to be twelve, huh? Sorry about that," she says, but the rolling of her eyes and the sigh she gives indicate she doesn't care at all. "Anyway, ten is a lot," she says, musing to herself. She kind of looks up, the wheels in her head clearly turning.

Niamh is deciding whether she wants to keep all ten of you. What does she decide?

1. Ten tiny little pets (or toys...)? Sounds pretty ideal. She keeps all ten of you to herself.

2. Ten tiny people is a lot. Niamh decides to divide you all between her and her closest friends.

3. Two words. SNAPCHAT GIVEAWAY! Niamh actually takes to social media to auction you guys off, one by one, to her Snapchat followers. You're all split up, and Niamh only keeps one or two of you to herself.
11113.title: Hope Lost

111132.content:
"Well, I obviously can't take care of all of you. That's like, a lot of work. So I guess I'll call up the girls and we can divvy you guys up," Niamh says down to you all.

She walks away, her fingers tapping quickly on her phone. Vanessa seems to be beginning to panic.

"She's gonna split us up! I don't want to be split up, we're all we have. We need each other!" she practically cries. Her tears had only just begun to dry from the loss of your friends, but now her cheeks are wet again thinking of all of you being split up. David and Laura are doing their best to comfort her.

In all honesty though, you find the thought equally upsetting. You were all in this together, and soon you'll be going your separate ways.

Niamh is back before long with a much smaller container that reminds you of tupperware. It has holes stabbed into the lid, and she's prying it off. It's easy to gather you'll all be going in there.

She doesn't give any warning or ask for permission, she just starts grabbing you all, one or two at a time, and dropping you into the plastic container. It's very unpleasant, having a giant hand just grab you without warning.

All in all, you don't have a lot of room, all ten of you squished into the container. But the slight claustrophobia is somewhat comforting, as you're all close to one another. The material of the container is opaque, so you can't really see outside. But you're able to figure out when Niamh shoves the container into her purse. You all huddle together and speak softly among yourselves, telling each other to be brave and that it'll be okay.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

A while has passed, you've felt lots of swaying and moving and familiar sounds like a car and chatter. Eventually you feel the container lifted out of the purse, and the ceiling is pried away. Looking up, you see the gigantic faces of Niamh, Liv, Makayla, and Madison looking down at you.

"Oh my gosh, they are so cute!" Madison squeals. Her high voice was piercing to your small ears.

"How many do we get?" Liv asked cooly.

"Well, there's four of us and ten of them. Do the math, Liv. Two of us get two, and two of us get three," Niamh replied.

"Well alright, but which of us get three?" Makayla asked.

"Well, obviously I get three. Which of you bitches gets three as well depends," Niamh responded.

"Depends on what?" Liv asked her.

"I wanna hear what your plans are. Then I'll decide who gets three," Niamh says.

Madison goes first. Madison is a cute blonde girl. She always seemed on the somewhat nicer side of the popular squad, but that's not necessarily saying a lot. She's on the shorter end, but she was still taller than Niamh.

"Well, my little people will probably be my little pets. I'll get them cute little jars with their names on them, or ooh maybe a cage. That could be cute because I could watch them play together. We can chill in our jammies and watch movies. And they'll be all over my insta, they'll get me so many followers," Madison laid out her plans. Niamh nodded.

Then it was Liv's turn. Liv has tanner skin, and a much dirtier blonde hair color than Madison. Liv always had a really chill demeanor about her, she was never as animated as some of the other girls. She was extremely pretty, and with her status coupled with her laid-back demeanor, it's hard to not feel like you need to impress her.

"I'll make mine serve me. I could use the pampering. They can expect to be giving a lot of foot rubs. And they can feed me grapes," she paused, looking down at us, her expression unchanging, "like a goddess." Niamh seemed more impressed.

Finally, it was Makayla's turn. Makayla was a brunette, with a warmer skin tone. She always seemed a little...well, it was hard to put into words. She often made quips when hanging around Niamh, and sometimes the stuff she said was kind of messed up. You think maybe she had a gear loose or something. Something was definitely off about her. Her response only proved you right.

"IDK, I'm gonna make 'em work hard as fuck, though. Maybe I'll make the little shits lick my shoes clean, or something else depraved. I know they'll work their little asses off though because if they don't, I'll eat 'em." Makayla said. She seemed kind of excited about getting to work some of you to the bone. She was definitely scary.

Niamh deliberated for a bit, before finally saying "Alright, I've decided. Liv gets three."

Liv's expression didn't change. Madison looked disappointed. Makayla's frightening look hadn't really dissipated.

Now all that was left was actually divvying you up. Who do you wind up with?
111132.title: The Queen's Posse

choices: You Both Getting Dumped into A Jar!
Madison on Instagram Live, Wanting to Show off Her Pets!
Madison's Mother, Looking Through Her Stuff!
Madison in Her Pajamas, Wanting To Spend Time!
1111321.content:
As the giants began to examine all of your friends, you stood there in horror. They really were just treating all of your peers as nothing but little things that were free for the taking, trading them like they were candy at the end of a long halloween night. As you saw the blonde titan named Madison set Jennifer down in her lap, the enormous pillars of her fingers came crashing down above you, wrapping around your body as she raised you high in the air.

You were petrified in fear as the giant bubbly face lit up upon your inspection, the blonde woman giggling as she turned you around to get a full look at your condition. She pressed her finger into your back as to playfully poke you, before turning you around and giving you a wet kiss, leaving an imprint of lipstick as she set you on her lap next to Jennifer. As the denim from her jeans folded underneath you, she looked up at the other three girls who were still arguing over who got who.

"I've got mine!" Madison proudly announced to her group, nodding down at the two of you. You thought about it for a moment, and were thankful that you got the easiest of all the options on the table. Sure it wasn't going to be ideal, living with some teenage girl who viewed you and Jennifer as pets that might garner her more social media fame, but the alternatives were becoming a slave, toy and potential snack with the other girls.

"Alright, that's fine with me." Said Niamh as she looked at who Madison had captured.

"Me too." Replied Liv, who went right back to fighting over the others with Makayla.

"Awww, I kind of wanted that little dude." Boomed Makayla as she crawled over to Madison, looking down at her lap, and more specifically you. "He looked like he would've been tasty!" She laughed, before snapping her teeth in front of you, making you and Jennifer flinch and fall backwards onto Madison's jeans.

"Stop it! Don't tease my pets!" Cried Madison, as she scooped the two of you into her palm, nestling you against the warm skin of her cheeks, rosy with excitement. "I can't have them getting hurt! I need them for my Instagram!" Makayla backed off, chuckling as she went back to deciding who went with who. "Alright, thanks Niamh! I need to get home, but I really appreciate it!" She started to open her purse, bringing her hand down.

"See you later! Have fun with your little people!" Replied Niamh, who went right back to her arguments with the other two. The hand sloped as you and Jennifer slid down into the bag, you landing first onto the expensive designer purse, and Jennifer landing right on top of you as she zipped up the top. As the room began to move, you turned to Jennifer, slipping her off of you and starting to talk.


"Does this mean that all our friends are going to be- Slaves?" You asked, terrified of what their fate had in store as a gigantic tube of lipstick loomed in the background. Jennifer got up and sat down on a pack of tissues as she looked solemn, right at you.

"I don't think it's best to focus on that. Let's just go with whatever's happening for us right now, and worry about them after we escape. After all, there is no saving them if we don't save ourselves." She said, with you nodding to affirm her statement. All you could do was wait for the purse to be opened, and for the woman who thought of herself as your owner to retrieve you. Eventually, the light opened revealing
1111321.title: Just a Pet

1111323.content:
The girls all start a process of choosing who gets who. You were a little too distracted thinking about the fates of each of your friends as they get picked to even really notice what the choosing process was.

You are glad for Sean and Jennifer, as they're going with Madison. Being the shrunken pet of a girl from your high school isn't the best lot in life, but compared to the alternatives, it's by far the best option. You know they'll likely be safe.

Eric, Vanessa, and David are going with Liv. You wish them luck, since you know they'll be working hard for Liv. She's laid back, but she's also serious. They're going to have to work hard to please her, and looking at her boots, you don't envy the fact that they're going to be massaging the feet entombed within soon.

Makayla has only selected Laura thus far. You feel the most bad for Laura. She's a really kind girl and an amazing friend, and looking at her now you shudder with the knowledge that Makayla's going to just work her until she breaks, then maybe actually eat her. It's the kind of thought that makes you need to hold back tears.

Niamh has selected Will and Tiffany. You don't think being Niamh's pets or toys or who knows whats will be a great fate, so you fear for them too.

You and Rob are the last ones left. Niamh is going to pick her last pet, and then whoever's left goes to Makayla. Niamh's hand hovers over the both of you.

Who does she choose?

1. You. While you're not excited to go with Niamh, it is far better than winding up with Makayla. You pity Rob though. Before being snatched away, you tell him to take care of Laura.

2. Rob. You watch him get snatched up by Niamh and you're left with Makayla grinning devilishly at you. You are terrified. Your only saving grace is that if there's anyone you'd want to be stuck in this nightmare scenario with, Laura is the best choice. Though, you wish she had a better fate.
1111323.title: New Owner

choices: Niamh Herself, May She Have Mercy
111133.content:
"You know? I have the perfect idea for what I'm gonna do with you guys!" Niamh said as her billboard sized face grew a smirk. "What's better than a good ole fashioned giveaway? Hold still guys, well it's not like you have a choice." She boomed, before taking out her cell phone to snap a quick picture of her prizes. "There we go! Posted to my story, and in no time I'll narrow my lot to either one or two of you!"

You still embrace Tiffany as she now starts to sob, realizing that in just a short period of time most of you will be divided and given away to this bimbo's social media following. Soon she started to announce who was going where, and this just caused the panic to grow from within the container.

"You little guy! You're going to my friend Tori. She's in need of a pet, but a dog seemed like too much work." Niamh said pointing directly at David. He panicked as she plucked him out, wrapping him in tape and writing 'Tori' on it with a sharpie.

"Can you believe what she just did? She's treating him like he's not even a person!" cried Jennifer.

"I can hear you, you know." The giantess said. "And by the way, I'm shipping you across the pond. My former foreign exchange student friend from England really needs to spice up her sex life, and she's not interested in boys. Say hi to Helen for me!" The same crane-like hand took her out, wrapping the same tape on her and writing 'Helen' like she was nothing more than a piece of candy.

As her announcements continued, you wondered where you were going to end up. Soon, the manicured finger of the most popular girl in school was pointed directly at you, announcing that you were going to

1. Gale, Niamh's friend who moved across the country. You were going far from home!

2. Josie, Niamh's rival/best friend depending on the day. She went to school across Atlas City.

3. Niamh had decided to keep you personally! Get ready for life with this sociopath.
111133.title: Snapchat Giveaway!

112.content:
Once everyone was composed enough to work together, you all gathered. Sean took on a leadership role, though your group was clearly working decently as a psuedo-democracy. You split up into four groups of three, and check different parts of the school. It seems like no one else was left. You guys were all alone in these massive halls.

You had all decided to meet up at the cafeteria once done scouting. It was easy enough to find food that you could eat from for the weekend. It's not like you all ate that much at your new size. Finding somewhere to sleep was a little tougher.You eventually discovered a backpack that was left behind. It was on its side, zipper open. A home ready to be made. So you all took trips carrying food back to the backpack so you could use it as a temporary hideout until Monday.

Passing the weekend was difficult. Time really dragged on, since so much of the world was shut off to you since you couldn't reach anything. Even formerly short distances felt more like miles now. Most of your time was spent together, talking, getting to know each other better, playing games. It was all you could do to pass the time. Once Sunday night rolled around, everyone was nearly too excited to sleep. You all stayed up extra late, and eventually even the sturdiest of you passed out due to exhaustion.

--------------------------------------------------------------

You awoke to Briana shaking you awake. You open your eyes, bleary.

"Huh..?" you mutter, looking around. Despite the lip of the backpack being mostly closed, the light that did manage to filter in was very bright. That wasn't sunlight, that was the bright overhead artificial lights. Oh yeah!

Monday morning! You sat up, noticing that those already awake were waking those harder to get up. Soon you were all awake, and formulating. Will took a peek outside your little backpack home. The digital clock display that hung from the ceiling in the middle of the hall read 7:06 am. Classes weren't too far from starting. Your plan to get help needs to go into action soon. Thankfully, the backpack was really close to a nearby classroom, so help wouldn't be far. Either you could get lucky, and get a teacher's attention, or you could get the attention of another student and have them bring you to a teacher for help. Either way, help would be had for the twelve of you. You would be returned to your normal heights.

What room was your bag-hideout outside of?
112.title: Surviving Through the Weekend

choices: Gasped as she noticed her class all shrunk
Gets irritated as she sees a swarm of bugs at her feet
Doesn't notice you at all. You had shrink further over the weekend!
1121.content:
*CLUNK*

The ground began to shake as 7:30 rolled around.

*CLUNK* *CLUNK* *CLUNK*

The shaking became more violent and more frequent. The others were starting to freak out as an ominous silhouette came in from the distance.
