Scale the water fountain - get to eye level!
134.content:
You see a familiar figure, although utterly massive - approaching the water fountain with pounding steps, shaking as they approach in red and black high-top basketball sneakers. Amber is in your grade, a teen with long black hair- some sort of mix of Hispanic and Asian, or.. Polynesian? It didn't matter much, because while she was a giant at your normal height -somewhere above 6 feet, now she was... huge. and it looked like she was practicing at the park courts, as sweat beaded off her brow and fell like rain to your tiny form. As she bent down the drink from the water fountain, you were nearly turned into a fine paste by her Adidas - and you can smell the unmistakable scent from here.

You steel your nerves - the brown-skinned giantess drinks deeply from the water fountain, basketball shorts and tanktop highlighting a star athletic body- and she was your best bet for help.

You-
134.title: Amber, the basketball player

choices: You're taking a back seat for now.
1341.content:
"Just get her to look down..." You took a deep breath as you cautiously approached Amber's foot. Already large to match her impressive height, it was scaled up dramatically. From your perspective, the girl's sneaker was bigger than a yacht.

You wrinkled your nose as you neared the mighty shoe. The thick aroma of perspiration hung in the air. You couldn't help but feel grossed out. You were like a bug at the behemoth basketball player's toes. Shuddering at the thought of what they would be like bare, you grabbed onto a single shoelace. You began pulling, slowly undoing the tight knot atop her foot.

"Hmmm?" You looked up in time to see Amber peer down from the sky, her giant cheeks still filled with water. Her dark eyebrows furrowed in confusion as she swallowed what would've been gallons of cool liquid to you. "What the hell?"

The smooth, sculpted legs towering above you began to bend as she crouched. Thick muscle bulged under the skin of her thighs and calves. An equally toned arm reached toward you, its enormous hand splayed open. You instinctively cringed as her fingers closed, swallowing you into a massive fist. You felt your dark prison begin to lift, carrying you into the heavens. Intense body heat radiated from the tough skin around you. As the tan hand opened again, you found it was about level with the hills of a tank top-clad chest.

After staring for a second too long, you yanked your gaze upward. The huge face looking back was admittedly rather striking. Deep, brown eyes were wide with shock. Full lips hung open, at a total loss for words. Even blown up to billboard-size, you couldn't see many flaws in her golden-brown skin. You froze, simultaneously a bit terrified and mesmerized.

1. Amber recognizes you and wants to help. She ends her practice early to take you back to her place.

2. Training comes first. She stashes you somewhere on her person until she's finished practicing.
1341.title: Athlete's Foot

choices: Amber shoves you in her bra.
Amber drops you in her shoe.
Amber decides to stick you in her duffel bag, which has clean clothes for now.
13412.content:
"Are you like, a tiny guy?" Amber asked aloud to herself. She clearly didn't expect an answer from you, because she immediately looked around to see if anyone else had seen this.

Amber looked back down at you, but her face betrayed that she was torn about something.

"Listen, small guy. I'm in the middle of practicing, and I take my basketball very seriously. Nothing else comes first. Not even the find of the century," she says, looking down at you with something almost like pity. Wait, did she just call you a 'find'?

She reached her other hand down to her shorts and patted the side of them, before furrowing her brow.

"Damn, I forgot, my basketball shorts don't have pockets. I have to find somewhere to keep you while I finish practicing..." she said, musing thoughtfully.
13412.title: Not a Priority

1343.content:
There's no time for this, no time to stop and think and plan. You wait out here any longer than is absolutely necessary and you're good as dead. Now you have someone who's stationary, who's head is leaned downwards, who you know from school, and you want to stop and think about it?

"Amber!" you shout, running out from the fountain's shadow. Her head's tilted slightly as she drinks, eyes unfocused as she re-hydrates. "Hey, down here! I need help!" You concentrate on her eyes, searching for any sign she could give.

And then she was done. Standing back to full height, she stretched, wiping her mouth dry with the back of her hand. You continued to scream and leap, terrified of being left alone here. Amber sighs, and turns away, ready to head back to the courts, and as she does so her eyes happen to cast downward, and happen to land on you.

"Yes! Yes, it's me, Nick! From class, remember?" Your heart lifts; this was easier than you could have hoped. Except, Amber's expression wasn't making sense. She didn't have the spark of recognition or the shocked gasp of confusion you expected. Instead her lips pursed into a grimace, her eyes crinkling with disgust. "Amber?"

Suddenly with a rush of wind her shoe's red rubber sole blocked out the sky. She thinks I'm a bug, you realize, and then she steps down.

You crumple, her toned calves generating tens of thousands of pounds of force. The last things you feel are her power, as lean muscle twitches beneath tanned skin, your remains bursting like a balloon, just to course through the channel-like indent's beneath her Adidas. With a final twist of her ankle she drags your pulp across the concrete, a nearly imperceptible red smear left in its wake.

Amber doesn't even bother checking, and your bloody, mushed corpse remains hidden on her sole for the rest of the day.
1343.title: Grab the goddess's attention

choices: Little girl building a sand castle.
The two bullies destroying sand castles.
The sun is blocked out by a large shadow. Someone found you.
14.content:
An entire week passed. You had nearly forgotten about the failed science project. It's late Spring, so things really started heating up again. Atlas Beach started to get its usual Summer crowds back, little by little, especially on the weekends.

Even getting to live in a city with a big, popular beach apparently doesn't turn you off enjoying going there. You were evidence of that, as you always go several times during the Summer. Oftentimes you don't even bother with the water, you just love the atmosphere. Everyone's having a good, carefree time.

You laid your towel out and applied your sunscreen. It was time to sunbathe for a bit. Lying down on your towel, you felt a little sleepy. You hadn't brought your wallet or anything with you, so you felt no harm dozing for a bit, despite having come alone. You let the sounds of waves and all the people and music surrounding you be your lullaby as you drifted off into peaceful slumber.

-----------------------------------------------------------

When you woke up, you could really feel the sun beating down on you. Somehow, it felt a lot more intense than before. You sat up, and looked around. Large, white fibers rose up from the ground in every direction, hundreds of feet all around. What was going on? Then you looked around you and saw the other beach dwellers. There was only one problem. They were absolutely mammoths. Every single one of them was humongous, and so far away. It didn't take long for you to realize that you had shrunken, and this strange expanse around you was your beach towel.

You had to get help from someone, but from who?

Your options were:

A nearby girl building a sandcastle. She looked about 7 or so. She looks very happy and positive, she could be nice to you.

Two girls you see stomping someone else's sand castle. They both look about 10 or so. They're clearly bullies, but they're the closest people to you. You think you saw one of them eying the aforementioned girl's sand castle.

Someone who looks about your age, also sun-bathing. Getting to her would be quite a trek, but she's a lot older and would probably be more understanding. Plus, since her eyes are closed, you can approach her with about any method you desire.

The lifeguard. She looks slightly older, probably 18 or 19. She's honestly pretty darn hot, but that's not why you want her attention. Clearly, if anyone is the authority to go to, it's gonna be here. But out of all of your options, she's the farthest. Anyone else is even farther, and not worth it. So who's it gonna be?
14.title: Under the Sun, by the Waves

142.content:
Everything and everyone looks so far away at your new size. You can't stand the thought of an immense trek, especially in this overbearing heat. You figure you might as well go to the two girls stomping sandcastles, since they're a lot closer than most others. Sure, they don't seem like necessarily the nicest, but they look to be around 10 years old or so. Surely they would help someone in need.

You begin the arduous journey of simply making it off your beach towel. You take long strides to avoid the large fibers offering too much resistance. And you do your best to ignore the sweltering heat. You think it's not too bad, until you reach the sand. Then, the heat gets so much worse. The ground itself feels like it's throwing heat right back up at you. Your only reprieve is you're pretty sure you're getting a decent tan right now.

Walking over the sand at your size is difficult, because it's like walking across dunes of gravel. After several minutes, you get the hang of it well enough, and you become focused on your goal. You zone in on the girls, they will save you, and you will get help. You continue your march.

THUD

A flesh-colored monolith stomps into the sand in front of you. Sand rains from above, pelting your skin. In only a moment, the monolith is gone. There is a large crater in the sand in front of you. Taking a moment to get your bearings after what felt like a near-death experience, you peek forward and see the crater is actually a footprint in the sand. You look off to your left, and see a giant woman, far away and getting ever farther, jogging in the sand barefoot.

You alter your path to go around the massive footprint, since you don't feel like trying to go through it, and now you take extra care to watch your surroundings. You would hate to get absent-mindedly crushed just because you weren't looking both ways before crossing the desert.

Eventually, you are finally near the girls. They are taking a short break, admiring the sandcastle they just finished turning to dust...er, sand. Their hands are on their hips and their faces filled with smirks. You do feel slightly concerned about them, but they're right here, now. And they're your best bet.

Which one do you approach?

1. The girl on the left. She's wearing a blue one-piece swimming suit with wave designs, has pale white skin, and shoulder-length wavy brunette hair. Based on what you've seen from watching the two girls, this one might be the lackey of the other.

2. The girl on the right. She's wearing a purple one-piece swimming suit with black accents. She has light brown skin and long, braided black hair. You think she may be the leader of their little duo.

3. Turns out they had a third friend...who came up behind you, and saw you before you saw them.
142.title: Sandcastle Crushers

choices: You decide to scale the bikini.
143.content:
Far away as she was, you knew the sunbather was probably your best option. The younger girls were closer but you weren't exactly comfortable with your fate being left in the hands of little kids. They would've little kids, anyway. You might’ve picked the lifeguard but she was even farther away. With the sun beating down, it would have been an even longer trek across what was to you a vast desert.

You felt downright puny as you trudged through the fibers of your own beach towel. It was a struggle just to get to the sand. Your bottle of sunscreen towered in the distance like a small office building. You were thankful for the lotion it contained, which was protecting you from the sunburn of a lifetime.

The journey across the sand was a nightmare. It shifted and sunk under your feet, nearly swallowing your entire lower body a few times. You were baked by the sun’s oppressive rays. It had been hot before but at your new size you might as well have been in an oven. To make matters worse, you’d occasionally cross paths with a colossal beach-goer. They lumbered by, never once noticing your minute presence at their toes. Their mammoth stomps almost buried you in a shower of white gravel. All things considered, you were lucky not to have ended up flattened in a giant footprint.

You were exhausted by the time you reached the edge of the girl’s towel. Up close, the surreal landscape of her body was jaw-dropping. Having approached from her side, you were directly across from the bottom of her white bikini. It stood out against a warm complexion. Her light brown skin seemed stretch endlessly in either direction. It was hard not to stare. The sunbather formed a wall of latte-colored flesh, glistening with a mixture of sweat and sunscreen.

You could just make out her face as you glanced far to your right. It was framed by a voluminous cloud of dark hair. Her eyes were closed, giving her a relaxed air. Her humongous torso heaved with every tranquil breath. She seemed entirely at peace. Hopefully she would be too mad at you for interrupting...

1. You head for her top. If you can make it up her chest, you'll be able to reach her face and get her attention.

2. You go for a safer (and less awkward) option, climbing into her hand. If you're felt, it'll essentially be an elevator to her eyes.

3. Before you can decide, she rolls onto her stomach! You end up trapped under her belly button.
143.title: Soaking in the Rays

choices: Visiting one of your sisters' schools (Junior High or Elementary).
15.content: We can nix the times on this one. But where do you shrink at?
15.title: More Locales

151.content:
You take in the ambiance of the cozy coffee shop, the tables filled here and there with a variety of patrons.

Nearest your table was a girl probably about 18 or 19, a bit curvy, pale and red-haired. Her features were very beautiful, and she seemed to be working on drawing something in a sketchbook. She was wearing a simple graphic top with leggings, and a pair of beat-up converse high tops that had probably seen better days. Perched atop her nose were a pair of large, cute glasses.

To your left was a blonde woman, probably in her mid twenties, who looked like she had just come in from jogging. She was a bit sweaty, breathing heavily, but in great shape - with a sports bra visible under a tight top, yoga pants, and running sneakers, she was downing water like her life depended on it.

To your right was a shy looking quiet girl reading a thick novel, who couldn't have been older than 15 or so, with long straight brown hair that came down to her mid back. She was in a a plain shirt, black skinny jeans, and a pair of floral flats with bows on them, with a small heel. She seemed very absorbed in her book.

You start to feel woozy as you enter the busy coffee shop - the bustle made your head ache as the sounds of coffee pouring, computers typing, and idle chit-chat grew to a dull roar. With a stumble, your eyes unfocus- the ground rushes up to meet you, as your shrink to almost invisible size. You gather your bearings - it looks like nobody even saw you vanish from your seat. You decide to get help, but from who?
151.title: Coffee shop.

choices: Head over the the grounded foot
Climb the outside of the discarded shoe
Enter her sweaty, worn, disgusting shoe
1512.content:
The choice is ripped from your hands as the chair you were beneath, the one you were sitting on normal sized just moments before, is pulled back. Its feet scrape against the tile, creating a teeth rattling screech as the jogger from earlier enters your view. She gives you no time, her toned legs sliding into her chair, her grey trainers aimed right for you.

"No, wait!" you scream, but the ambiance of the shop drowns you out. The dingy soles, once a pristine white but now worn smooth and tarnished gray, hover overhead for a heart-wrenching moment, before splitting away and slamming to the ground to both sides of you, resting on their toes with her heels against the chair legs. Her pale skin peeks out from a hint of ankle sock, leading to her towering calves that soared up and out of view.

You sink to your knees. How did this happen? You were a normal guy, just living your life, but now? Now you're- you're-

You can't bring yourself to think the word "bug." Yes, you were small and yes, this random stranger was a deity to you now, but you couldn't give up. This was because of the damn chemical spill, and if you could cause it you could fix it. All you had to do was get this woman's attention.

The woman's chair creaks as she moves. You're awestruck as her hand descends from above the table top; you watch, enraptured, as she jams a finger between foot and shoe, the sounds of her itching roaring over you once, twice, three times, before her forearm tightens, and with force you could never hope to muster, she pulls her foot free. The discarded trainer clatters sideways to the ground mere feet from you, its yawning mouth releasing a cloud of sweaty air over you, as she pulls the freed foot up and tucks it beneath herself.

You throw your hands over your mouth, struggling to catch your breath. God, that's beyond rank. Even at this distance, the air felt humid, as if her jogging had imbued the very atmosphere with her sweaty essence. Still, this presented an opportunity. The discarded shoe was stationary and made of rather worn out fabric, an easy climb. If you could secure yourself on it, you could hitch a ride with this woman until a better chance to grab her attention arose.

A shift in air currents blows another fresh gust of her scent your way, and you have to hold back a gag. Then again, it might be better to stay far away from that rank, dank cave. Her other foot, still completely shoed, was only a little further away. Maybe you could just climb that? It seemed still enough.

You see a waitress's thick slip-proof shoes stomp over, her voice ringing out above. "What can I get for ya?" Time was running out, before your closest chance at salvation got back up and stranded you.
1512.title: At the base of the jogger

choices: Climb her flats and tap at her feet
Climb her flats and tie yourself to their bows
Too late - The waitress is back!
1513.content:
The ground rumbles as you sprint across the open plain of tiles. Each step covers only fractions of an inch, yet the towering teen seems to grow further and further as you approach. Still, you head on, focused on her, or more specifically her flats. The exposed skin is your best bet to getting noticed.

"Good morning. Can I get your order?" A voice rings out from the heavens, and without warning a wall of black drops down before you. The force knocks you from your feet, and with a yelp you tumble into the hard rubber. The waitress who's shoe you just slammed into doesn't react. You peer up, heart dropping as you realize that you need to crane your neck to even see the pale strip of ankle between sock and trousers.

As the girl speaks her order, the waitress rocks her foot forward, resting her weight on its ball and revealing its towering sole to the world. It soared over you, a dark, scuffed maze, with foodstuffs of all kind jammed in the treads. You gulped, frozen in fear, staring at chunks of fries and pastries and sandwiches, each large enough to feed you for a month, and each trampled beneath the woman's steps beneath her notice.

Then, as soon as it had appeared, her foot vanished, the rush of displaced air pulling you to the ground. "I'll be right back with your drink~," she said, her voice echoing in the distance, already becoming lost in the coffee shop's din.

You struggle to your feet. The image of the waitress's sole was engraved in your mind... You couldn't help but see yourself among it, a red splotch hidden between other stains she carelessly trod upon.

Suddenly your plan to get the bookworm's attention seemed hasty. Sure, you could probably touch her skin, but now that you've seen just how insignificant you are, how were you going to ever get her to feel you? Her skin, usually soft and delicate, was now a tough armor, thicker than your body! Plus, the so called "easy" path still involved getting on top of her shoes, which in hindsight would require you to actively climb the floral flats on her feet. What if she moved? Or what if she just didn't feel you?

You had the sudden feeling that you were going to die like this...
1513.title: Cut off

choices: Pulls her heel out of her shoe
15131.content:
You rethink your options as the earthshaking steps of the waitress grow further, eyeing the floral pattern of the teen's flats. With a resolute breath, you make up your mind - this was still the best option, it had the least amount of steps, and the least amount of danger - the bookworm was very still, at least for now - but who knew when that might change? You had to act, and fast!

With a cautious air, you approach the wall of the towering flat. At your size, it might not be feasible to tackle it head on- the bow at the front dangles just off the edge, providing a handhold up. After some walking, you make it to the fabric, and begin hoisting yourself up the teen girl's footwear.

You could feel the heat radiate from the foot below, a subtle reminder of just how small you had become - this young girl's foot was like an entirely different environment, as you pull yourself up on to the floral print of the stylish flat. The five toes wriggle below, displacing the surface of the flat like a small-scale earthquake, sending you wheeling your arms for balance.

It was now or never - you grit you teeth and crawl forward, the toe of the flat parting to reveal the cleavage of the bookworm's toes - bare, you noticed, as a wave of heat and slight feminine odor wash over you like a strong breeze. You reach out your hand to touch the soft-looking flesh below, and the girl -
15131.title: Climb her flats and tap at her feet

151311.content:
The moments following contact are the longest of your life. The situation hits you like a train; you're the size of a bug, leaning over the edge of a teen's flat, willingly touching her despite knowing that she's a deity who could end your life with no resistance. What exactly are you hoping for here? If she moves, you're gonna be flung off, and if she sees you its only gonna be as the speck you are, nothing but a bug to be squashed.

But, the seconds pass. You start to sweat, the heat radiating off her skin getting to you. Everything was still.

Then, with speed that shouldn't have been possible, she moved, her foot rocketing backwards. You're thrown back, your screaming form slamming into the fabric of the bow, clutching to it with all your worth as the goddess moves. You screw your eyes shut, screaming as terrible g-forces threaten to rip you apart. Then, stillness once again. Her toes beneath you flex, the floral ground shift with her smallest motions.

Mustering all your courage, you open your eyes. You skim past the football-field length of bare flesh that made up the teen girl's foot, peered far above the expansive length of her legs, up and up, to where you saw her face, now peering down below the table, down towards you. Her eyes, the same shade of brown as her cascading hair, flitted about, scanning the area for whatever graced her skin.

You struggle back to your full height, ignoring the throbbing bruises she created just by shifting her foot. "Oi!" you shout, projecting your voice as best as you could. "Miss, I need your help! Down here, on your foot!" But despite your best efforts, your voice seemed to be falling on deaf ears. Her face is slowly shifting, interest in whatever touched her fading fast. You have to do something--

Acting on instinct more than anything, you throw yourself onto her bare skin once again, jumping with all you're worth. "Miss, please! I don't wanna die like thi-woah!" She shifts again, less so this time, and you fall prone. But, it seemed to work; above, whispered so softly that even you nearly missed it, you hear a quiet "What- what is that?"

You have just enough time to flip onto your back before her hand overtakes you, and without warning you're encased in her soft flesh, screaming as she lifts you...
151311.title: Foot contact

choices: "Did you come out of my book?"
1513112.content:
You freeze as the titanic brown pupil focuses in on your tiny form, squinting with a benign curiosity at the hitchhiker on the plain of bare foot flesh below. As you shout and shimmy for recognition, you see the brows raise like bridges, in a genuine expression of shock and curiosity as a slender hand darts down from on high.

You have no chance at speech, no recourse, as the pale fingers of the teen wrap around your form with a firm but gentle grip, trapping your body in a warm, slightly clammy cocoon of flesh as the girl's fingers curl around you gently. She hadn't seemed to hear your tiny voice, but she did seem to see you- that was good, right?

You wince as the bottom of your stomach drops out, insane G-forces acting on you as you move what feels like thousands of miles per hour, up - you think.

The curious brunette opens her pocket with the fingers holding you, and with a gentle shake, deposits you, tumbling wildly down a fabric pit to rest at the bottom, as the curious fingers of your new captor retreat, the pocket growing darker as the light is cut off by walls of shifting fabric. You could feel the warmth of her body all around, but you still weren't sure if this was a helpful gesture, or something much more sinister.

The girl snaps her book shut, and scurries off to the restroom - once there, she fishes the mysterious figure out of her pocket with trembling fingers.You see the inquisitive brown eyes once more, framed by her long, straight chestnut hair. Her lips form cautious words, as she whispers -
1513112.title: Up to her pocket!

15131122.content:
You tumble onto the cold marble of the counter-top. What the hell? you think, struggling back to your feet. This wasn't what you'd expected.

She's staring right at you, eyes locked on your quivering form. A minute passes; she stares, trying to understand how you can be there, a tiny person standing before her, and you stare right back, trying to take in the majesty of someone so huge.

"Y-you're all mine." Her cheeks turn a light pink. "I-I mean, I'm your owner. Now."

What? "I'm not property!" you shout back at her.

Her head shakes, brown hair whipping back and forth. "I can't hear you. I mean, I think you're trying to speak, but you're so small...

...I don't think anyone's ever gonna hear you again."

This wasn't how this was supposed to go! She was going to get you help, find some authority figure who knew how to fix this. Now she's gonna own you, like some kind of pet? You turn and run, suddenly very aware of how little power you held, very aware of how this girl's presence flooded your entire world. The scent of her body wash tickled your nose, the sound of her slightest motions rumbled over you, the lingering heat off her skin still keeping you warm. She wasn't bluffing or joking or demanding anything; she was all yours, and you were all hers.

You make it a few steps towards the distant skin basin when the sky crashes down in front of you, her pointer finger alone wide enough to block you. Carried by momentum, you slam into it, bouncing off the plush flesh and landing firmly on your backside.

The girl giggles, but stops and blushes as you turn and look back at her. "Sorry," she said, though her poorly hidden smile said otherwise. She settles on her knees, bring her eyes level with the counter - and with you. "I just realized, I don't know anything about you little guy. Or, uh, g-girl. You're just so small, I can't tell. What am I gonna call you?"

"My name is Nick!" you shout, crawling towards her huge brown eyes. You can't even fit both in your field of vision, she's so close, so you focus on her left one. "I'm Nick Lewis, I'm a student at Hyperion High School, and I'm a person!"

She blinks. If she even noticed your cries, she's not showing it. "I'm gonna call you Tiny. That's a pretty neutral name, and it's pretty fitting~!"

"Now, let's..."
15131122.title: Property by default

153.content:
Nearly a week has passed since your little spill, and life had carried on. You and your friends had all agreed to pretend the little mishap had never happened, and by the weekend when none of the teachers had found out, you all figured you were in the clear.

You were sitting at the kitchen table, enjoying your breakfast toast before heading off to school, when your phone rings.

Mom? you think, checking the caller ID. She had just left to drop Andy off at daycare, since his nanny was out of town for the week. What does she want?

"Hello, honey? I need a favor," she says as you pick up.

"Yeah, what's up?"

"Your sister forgot her lunch for school today and she needs someone to drop it off." You glance at the counter, and sure enough a brown paper bag is sitting there, your sis's name scrawled on it in sharpie. "Could you drop it off before you head to Hyperion?"

"Why me? Can't you do it?"

"Nick, you know Hyperion starts later than the other schools in the district. I'm already running late as is and if I stop home I'll never make it on time." You hear her shushing Andy, his faint cries in the background. "Please dear?"

You sigh. You had the time, sure, but that didn't mean you wanted to use it for delivery. Still, your mom seemed desperate. "Alright," you say with a sigh. "I'm on it."

"Thank you dearie. We'll have your favorite for dinner tonight. I've got to go, love you~!"

You quickly finish up breakfast and get dressed, and grab the bag for delivery. Who's lunch got forgotten, anyhow?
153.title: A week later...

choices: A teacher, with a fresh stack of copies.
A student, skipping towards the restroom.
The secretary, coming to see if you were alright.
1531.content:
You park your bike outside Helios Elementary, lunch sack in hand, not bothering to lock it since this should be quick and easy. Heading in, you stop in the office. A middle aged woman with long black hair and a thick grey sweater greets you.

"Hi, I'm dropping off this lunch for Sophie Lewis," you say, placing the sack on the desk.

She takes it with a smile. "Well aren't you a sweet brother. Doesn't Sophie usually get a ride with Mrs. Lewis? Why didn't she bring it."

You shrug. Wish I knew, lady. "She's running late today. Had to drop off my younger brother at daycare."

The secretary smiles. "You're a sweetheart. Not every brother would do that, ya know?"

"Yeah..." you say. Usually you eat that kinda praise up, but all of a sudden you're feeling woozy. "I'm sorry, but where's the closest toilet."

"Just out and down the hall, hard to miss." She frowns, noticing your eyes sink and your face flush. "You feeling all right there?"

"Just-just fine." You grit your teeth into a smile, the feeling of vertigo suddenly extremely intense. "Have a-a grea-ay."

You stumble into the Hall, clutching your gut. What's happening?! The hallway stretches out before you into infinity, the harsh ceiling lights mini suns miles above. Everything is blurry, spinning, twisting, then the floor rushes up and meets you.


"I'm fucking tiny!" you scream, shocked by the sudden expanse of floors and walls. "What the hell, what the hell, is this 'cause of Sean's wonder serum?" You shudder, staring out at the single floor tile that could easy hold a football stadium, and the gargantuan walls, plastered in billboard sized works of elementary art. "Oh God, what am I going to do? What am I supposed to-"

Boom.
Boom.
Boom.
Boom!

You're thrown to the floor by the rapid approach of footsteps. You wimper, and look up to see that, heading your way, was the gargantuan figure of...
1531.title: Elementary, my dear Nick

choices: No time, the bell rings and students flood the courtyard
You head towards the closest class building
You head towards the school offices
1533.content:
Considering you were in high school and Emily was in high school, one might think it would be easy and convenient for you to take her forgotten lunch to her. However, things weren't quite as simple as driving to Hyperion High and dropping it off, mostly due to the fact that Emily didn't go to Hyperion High. After junior high, your mom and Emily had talked it over and Emily had gotten her way. She got to go to Selene School for Girls, a girls only high school on the other side of Atlas City with a notable reputation for its athletics program (and the associated college scholarships its students often received).

However, you did as your mother had asked, and drove over to Selene. Along the way you did fume a lot about having to do this for Emily. You and her had already had a pretty bad argument the other day that left you feeling bitter. Not to mention, you felt like her bringing her lunch revealed how spoiled she could be, considering you bought your own lunch at school.

Eventually, you arrived at Selene School for Girls, a far more prestigious looking set of buildings than Hyperion. It even had a gate and wall around the school grounds, which you nervously walked up to once you had parked.

"Do you have business here?" A feminine voice spoke up, amidst a bit of static, after a confused look around, you eventually noticed a black intercom box, a light indicating it was active.

"Uh...I'm Emily's brother, she forgot her lunch at home," You replied, feeling a little odd about being here. You held up the bag and gestured to it, unsure if the voice was watching you.

"I see, her mother called ahead and cleared it, please bring it to the main office straight ahead." The voice replied, her tone serious and businesslike as if to suggest you should not wander of. Accompanying this, the gate ahead shuddered and slide open while the light on the intercom went out.

If you had any questions they'd have to wait. Still the instructions were clear enough as you walked into the central courtyard. Inside the wall, you saw a three story building ahead at the end of a well-kept lone divided by crisscrossing sidewalks. It was flanked on either side by longer two story buildings that looked to be classrooms.

You manage a few steps before you're overcome by a sudden bout of dizziness. You end up dropping Emily's lunch sack as you fingers go numb. Clutching your head, you end up going down on your knees. Your ears ring for a moment, your vision goes white and the whole world shoots up aground you. Coming to a second later, you glance back and see you're in the shadow of Emily's lunch bag, barely an inch tall. The only cause must have been the accident in school almost a week ago, but for now, you needed to figure out what to do...
1533.title: Selene School for Girls

154.content:
The weekend had gone by without a hitch, though you were still fairly nervous as you went into school that day. A jittery feeling of anxiety haunted you at the start of the day as you worried about whether or not someone involved had told a teacher or the chemistry teacher had noticed something amiss in the class. It faded by the end of the day though as you managed to avoid getting into trouble.

By that point, you had bigger things to take care of. On Monday, your mom helped out with one of several after school programs. That in turn left you, the oldest, in charge of making sure you and your siblings were fed. Today would be a nice change of pace though. Emily had a cross-country meet which would no doubt be followed by a trip to the mall. Samantha had an away soccer game that would have her out till late in the evening. Sophie was over at a friend's house to have dinner. Then finally Andy had been taken on a playdate with his nanny's niece. In short, the house would be your's and, more importantly, you could eat what ever you wanted without having to take any of your siblings' picky tastes into mind.

Fast food seemed the best option, a bit of a treat considering you usually just heated up TV dinners or made mac and cheese (one of few foods all your siblings would enjoy). It was also an excuse not to put in extra work on cooking. Still, fast food left you with plenty of options, options you debated as you sat in your car, watching Hyperion High's parking lot slowly clear out.

Titan Burger was the go-to fast food place in town, a bit of a local icon actually. It was famous throughout the city for its thick, greasy burgers and signature chili fries. You even got tourists stopping in the city just to try it. Downside there was, of course, it would be pretty crowded and busy at this hour. Students stopped in there after class, families came in for an early dinner, college students snuck in for cheap meal. It might be a slight wait, it would definitely be noisy, but it had been so long since you had a Titan Double Cheeseburger that it would probably be worth it...

Slice of Heaven Pizza, on the other hand, was a much smaller place, hidden in a strip mall on the other side of the grocery store. Most people passed it up in favor of larger chains, but as far as you were concerned that was a very big mistake. Slice of Heaven had some of the best pizza in Atlas City, not to mention a generous selection of toppings, sauces, crusts, and cheese. There was only one downside. Shelby, their new delivery driver, has hated you since you turned down her friend's romantic advances. Still, a walk-in would minimize your chances of running into her and hopefully prevent any tampering with the pizza.

Circe's Subs and Sandwiches was probably the worst choice of the three places you had in mind. Circe's was a small local chain of sub shops that let you customize your sandwich, sub, or wrap in one of four cookie cutter establishments. It was a bit of a healthier option, yes, but also a bit more expensive. There was, however, one thing that would encourage you to go there. You knew from previous visits that this Circe's hired a lot of cute girls for part-time positions AND had a pretty hot manager running the place. Add in the fact that Monday was a slow day and you might be able to start something up...

You drummed the wheel, watching as the last few cars exited the lot. With a nod and a smile, you turned the key, put it into drive, and started to head for ______.
154.title: Fast and Cheap Dinner

155.content: Still not good enough for ya? Alright, I feel ya. Well here's some more places to choose from.
155.title: Even More Locales

choices: Go for the throng of kids at the fighting cabinet.
Try and approach the focused tween girl.
Go further down to the skee-ball tracks.
1551.content:
You had poked your head into an old-style arcade at the mall, the sounds of the machines and the blinking lights catching your eye as you walked by. You had the time to kill, so you figured, why not?

As you grabbed a few dollars in quarters from the change machine, however, you start to feel... odd. The pit of your stomach feel heavy, and the room starts to spin. The arcade was mostly deserted, save for a handful of kids and tweens, and in the dim light nobody noticed your rapid loss in size. Your body dwindled in an instant, your tiny form stumbling near a handful of groups.

To your left was a group of young boys all clustered around a fighting game. Two of them were intensely focused on the buttons while the rest cheered or jeered them in response to the moves. There had to be 5 or 6 of them, and they looked relatively young- you'd guess they ranged from 7 to 14. They seemed really interested in their game, but one of them might see you.

To your right, there was a lone girl in a heavy sweatshirt and sneakers who looked to be playing to beat the high score. She looked like she had been here a while, her hair kind of greasy - she didn't seem to care about appearances, and she must have been somewhere from 14 to 18 years old. She was pretty focused as well.

There was more arcade to search, if you wanted to go to the skee-ball racks, you might find someone more easily approached.
1551.title: The Arcade

15511.content:
You decide to approach the throng of kids at the fighting game. After all, with that many eyes, someone was bound to see you down here, right?

As you make the trek towards the distant cabinet, you narrowly avoid being smeared into paste by a passing shoe, reminding you to be careful - at your size, you were really vulnerable to people that might not even see you!

Luckily, you make it to the base of the game in one piece. Focusing with a powerful intensity on the screen is a kid that looks to be about 13 or 14 years old. You have to squint pretty hard to make out his face, but it looked like he was Asian-American, and going to town on the buttons and joysticks as the other kids looked on in amazement. He had on a pair beat up of black Vans, that bounced up and down a little too close for comfort.

To his left were what appeared to be two twins, about 9 or so - they had matching light-up skechers and freckles, each of them sporting a head of blonde hair and enthusiasm as the older boy approached the all-time high score!

To his right was a shy looking kid, about 11 or 12, in a pair of skinny jeans with torn up converse. It looked like he wanted to play too, but the older kid had been hogging the machine. Maybe he'd notice you?

Placing a quarter on the till of the cabinet was a sporty looking kid with black hair who looked like he had just come from a soccer game - his black and yellow uniform was covered with grass stains as he challenge the reigning champ, his black cleats shaking off grass on the dingy old carpet. You're not sure who would be the best person to approach...
15511.title: Go for the throng of kids at the fighting cabin...

choices: The Kid in the Soccer Uniform
155112.content:
You see the pair of freckled twins stomp their light up sneakers and wince at the though of being under them - best not to get too close to them, you decide.

You look up at the teen at the arcade game, fixated on the screen with his tongue poking from his lips in an expression of abject concentration. His body was relatively still, so it looked like it would be safe enough to approach him. Maybe he would be the best option for getting some help?

To his right was that shy looking kid in a hoodie, peering at the screen with a bit of a pout. He looked like a bit of a skater or scene kid, his converse squeaking on the floor as he watched the older boy play. He wasn't as involved, so it's possible he might see you - but he might think you were a bug.

Approaching the cabinet and narrowly avoiding smearing you into a red paste under his cleats, the short black-haired boy stomped over to place a quarter on the machine. He was clearly just fresh from a game of soccer, black-and-yellow socks smeared with grass stains. He was the closest, so maybe it'd be best not to move around too much?

After weighing your options, you decide to go for -
155112.title: Someone else!

choices: The Mother and Her Two Brats
1552.content:
A few days had passed since the incident. The weekend felt very intense, with the nagging feeling that someone might have told a teacher or their parents. Monday passed with the same feeling, but by evening, it had faded. Tuesday in turn was a normal day and by the end of it, the incident was in the back of your mind. Partially that was due to you having more important things to think about.

'Nick, please stop at Rhea's Market and pick up a gallon of milk, a dozen of eggs...' The list went on from there, but you had the basic idea looking over the text message from your mother when you finally got out of school. Rhea's Market was a grocery store that you passed every day on your way back from school. It would be a slight detour, but there wasn't much point in arguing about it, especially via text. At the very least your were confident your mom would reimburse you for what you had to spend.

A few minutes later, you'd pulled into the parking lot for Rhea's market, parked, and gone inside. The grocery store wasn't too terribly crowded, stepping in you saw at least a few people there. Though glancing around, you grumbled as you realized no shopping carts were present at the entrance. Hoping, with any luck, you might find one abandoned further in the store, you begin to walk.

For the most part the customers you passed looked to be a bit older than you, likely college students restocking their dorms after classes. Some seemed a bit more drained than others, as you could confirm when you brushed shoulders with a tired-looking blonde as she hobbled around the corner. She turned to face you for a moment, giving you a good view of the typical too-lazy-to-care college girl attire; graphic t-shirt, sweat pants, and Ugg boots.She grumbled something, but otherwise continued on, carrying a basket belabored with junk food and ramen.

Still, she was a lot better of an encounter than what you found on the next aisle. A mother in her early thirties, wearing a frustrated expression stepped past you, her two pretreen children parading after with cheers and screams. The mother was pretty good looking, especially given her red hair and hefty chest, but her two bratty kids definitely encouraged you to shuffle past her in your continued search for a cart. You glanced back, silently hoping a look might quiet the two kids down. The brown-haired girl, likely the younger one, was constantly trying to sneak items from the shelves into the cart. In contrast to the red-head who waited till the right moment to tell on her sister, in hopes of getting her in trouble.

"Just need to find a cart and get out of here," You muttered to yourself, briefly thankful that as much as your sisters got on your nerves, none of them were that ill-behaved.

The task you spoke of would soon become that much more difficult. As you exited the previous aisle, you felt a wave of nausea. Your vision wavered and faded for a second as you stumbled backwards onto your ass. The world around you felt like it was expanding as your stomach did a flip. You blinked a few times, your vision returning to you as you held back a wave of nausea. The tiles beneath you shook. Boom. Boom! BOOM!

A massive black object landed to your left, lifting up a second later to reveal a dusty tread pattern. It took a few seconds to realize as you watched the object continue to rise and fall. You'd been shrunk!

Watching with new realization, you saw the the black object was actually a massive tennis shoe. Following it up, you quickly made out a dark-skinned woman, probably only a year or two older than you. Judging by her outfit, black shoes, black pants, and a green apron...she was a worker at Rhea's Market. Admittedly, you couldn't help but stare as she squatted down a few dozen feet away from you, backside pressing against her tight pants. She stared at a display of cereal boxes ahead of herself, regarding it with a bored expression that suggested she was feigning working.

Glancing around at the sound of more foot steps, you saw that more people were closing in on this intersection. The mother of two was pushing her cart down, the wheels closing in dangerously face. The college girl with the basket was coming up the aisle you'd just come from, not really paying attention where she was going. Fortunately, rather than all running over you....they stopped. The mother stopped to scold her two daughters as she caught one trying to sneak a chocolate bar in. The college girl paused to look at the prices of mac and cheese. You had time to make a choice now....which would you try to get the attention of?
1552.title: Grocery Store

15522.content:
"Mommy!" One of the girls said, "there's a bug over there," pointing at you, "I want it!" The brat seemed to be about 11.

"Of course, love," said the mom. She walked over and said, "my daughter wants you, and she will have you!" She picks you up and brings you over.

"Yay!" The girl puts you in her pocket, and she finished shopping with her mom.
15522.title: The Mother and Her Two Brats

1553.content:
Perhaps the serum's effect was delayed not by hours, or days, or even a week. Maybe its effects only become apparent a month later, when your summer vacation is in full swing? It could be that the serum needed time to spread or maybe it was incomplete and an outside stimuli triggers its activation.

You could be getting ready for the end of your senior year, taking a tour of the local colleges as you decide on your major.

Or maybe you were taking it easy, going on a trip to a nearby amusement park...
1553.title: Extremely Delayed Effects

choices: That sounds like a good idea
15533.content: Since it's been a few months as the serum hasn't taken effect yet and it's still summer vacation for you how about a family trip to a another country? They're many countries that you can end up shrinking in like China, India, France, etc..
15533.title: More locations?

choices: Still not good enough, give me more!!!
155332.content:
(Oy vey...I hate choice chapters, especially when they go on and on and on...but it's always nice to have choices! Keep in mind that this should pretty much the only part in this story with so many choice chapters.)

1. Life's been going on as normal, however you did win a contest at school to spend the day with a celebrity! Unfortunately, that day is also when...well...I'm sure you can guess.

2. Your mom got your sister Samantha a ticket to see the Atlas City Demigods for her birthday, your city's female [sport] team, since Samantha is a huge fan. Your mom bought a ticket for herself to take her, but she's unfortunately busy that day. So she asked you to take her, and you happily agreed since you think the Demigods are kinda awesome anyway.

3. Good lord more choices
155332.title: More...Choices...Still...Ohmygosh...

1553321.content:
You had entered into the contest way back in December, you had all but forgotten about it. Well, time had finally come to select a winner and you were surprised when the morning announcements called out your name as the winner. You hadn't really believed it at first, but when you showed up at the office to receive your instructions it started to feel a little more real.

You would be meeting them at a discreet location so as not to draw too much attention or paparazzi. Of course, there would be plenty of pictures taken later, but for first meeting them it was supposed to be on the down-low so as to not stress you out too much. Thankfully they were already in town, so you would meet them in private and spend some time in Atlas City before getting to fly out with them to [probably California].

Which celebrity are you meeting?

(okay so obviously this has potential to become another choice-fest. So sorry about that, I literally just complained about it in the previous chapter. Obviously as I am writing this chapter, I'm allowing it here too, but try not to go overboard please. I have seen how lengthy celebrity interactives get just trying to choose the celebrity)
1553321.title: Meeting a Celebrity

choices: Shrunk in Ariana Grande's Hotel Suite
Shrinking Right in Front of Ariana Grande
15533211.content:
When you had heard the contest was to meet Ariana Grande, you had signed up in a heartbeat. You're sure your female classmates were likely to be the majority of the signups, but you honestly loved her music and had a massive crush on her. Even before she was the huge star she is today, she used to be your favorite cast member on Victorious when you were younger.

So of course you signed up. It was the fact that you won that completely floored you. You couldn't believe it. You were gonna meet your childhood crush and the biggest name in pop right now, Ariana Grande.

You had to sign a bunch of documents and legal things you didn't understand, but before long you had someone driving you to the Asteria Hotel, the fanciest hotel in all of Atlas.

The kind lady who drove you there walked you through the lobby, and tried to usher you along as you took in the sights. Someone as not-rich as you never had any reason to step into the Asteria before, but it lived up to its reputation. Everyone around looked like they were some degree of wealthy for sure.

After a short elevator ride, you were dropped off at a room high up in the hotel, and the lady let you inside. She told you Ariana was inside her bedroom in the suite, and that you could wait in the living room portion, which you had just entered.

"Alright sweetie, Ariana will be out shortly, she knows you're going to be here, so you won't startle her or anything. I have some errands to run for her, so I'll be gone a while, but you two can hang out and do whatever. You guys will have a couple of days to do whatever before we fly you out to California for a couple of weeks," the woman told you, and left.

You took a moment to admire the room, you had never been in a hotel suite before. You were used to single hotel rooms. This place looked really nice, you understood why the Asteria had a good reputation.

Your stomach began to hurt, though. Man, bad timing. You clutched your stomach and doubled over, worried about this intense feeling.

What happens?

1. The feeling passes. You're fine for now. Ariana Grande comes out and you finally meet her. (You won't shrink for a while)

2. This is it! You shrink immediately, before Ariana Grande even gets to meet you. But now you're stuck in her hotel suite, and she'll be coming out soon...

3. You think the feeling passes, and you wait. Ariana Grande comes out to meet you, but you shrink right in front of her eyes.
15533211.title: Ariana Grande

155332112.content:
The stomach pain crescendoed until you imploded and your environment exploded simultaneously. The ground rushed up at you as if you were skydiving in a sped up video where the carpeted floor of the hotel room was miles down below. But when you should have braced for impact, instead you found yourself on your hands and knees.

The pain was intense, but it passed, until you could begin thinking straight again. But what was that utterly strange sensation you felt alongside the pain?

You push yourself off the ground to your feet, but right away you notice what's wrong. The carpet, the fibers and strands are huge. And once you're up, it's so obvious. The whole room, Ariana Grande's hotel suite, is massive. Well it was pretty big before, but now we're talking like, it would take you all day to get to the other side of the room.

Looking around, you tried to get a sense of your scale. You were the size of a bug. As if your day couldn't get any more surreal than meeting Ariana Grande, now you were bug-sized in her suite. What is this, some sort of powerful cosmic balance?

Well, given the situation, what's your plan of action?

1. Ariana will be out soon, so you'll just sit here and wait until she comes out, and then you can try to get her attention then.

2. Instead of waiting for her to come out, you should go to where she is. It shouldn't be too difficult to figure out where her room is.

3. There are two tennis shoes next to the couch. One is partially sitting above the other, giving it increased height. The corner of the blanket on the coach is draped off the side, next to the shoes. From here it's hard to tell if it's possible or not, but you think you may be able to climb Ariana's tennis shoes to get onto the couch, and hopefully make you easier to spot.
155332112.title: Shrunk in Ariana Grande's Hotel Suite

choices: Success! You grab onto the blanket and are able to climb up!
Failure! You fall off the shoe and land on the carpet below. Oof.
Oh no...failure...you fall into Ariana Grande's running shoe.
1553321123.content:
You saw a pair of white and gray running shoes near the couch, one propped up from sitting partially on the other. They looked familiar, you're pretty sure they're running shoes from an ad you saw Ariana promoting them in. You're kinda surprised to see them, the ad wasn't super recent and you assumed she got new shoes so often something older like these wouldn't see the light of day much.

No matter, if you could climb them you might be able to reach the corner of blanket draped off the couch, dangling just above them. It should be a lot easier to get her attention higher up like that.

You don't bother running, because you know you'll spend a lot of energy climbing. So you walk towards the distant shoes, fighting the rough terrain of huge carpet strands the whole way.

It blew you away how it practically looks like you're in an alien environment. A pair of shoes in the distance look like huge looming buildings to you. When you finally approach them, climbing them suddenly seems a lot easier said than done.

Taking your time to asses the shoes, you notice something peculiar. These shoes seem dirtier and more worn than you would expect. You find a decent grip near where the ball of the foot would be inside, and manage to pull yourself up on top of the shoe with some great effort. Up the laces was easier, they acted as decent footholds but some climbing effort was still required.

What got tough was transferring from one shoe to the other. The heel of the other shoe was propped up on top of this shoe. You struggled to find somewhere to pull yourself up, but eventually you found some decent dips in the designs of the shoe that you got enough friction with your skin to pull up.

All in all climbing both shoes took you a good fifteen minutes, but eventually you were pulling yourself up on the rim of the mouth of the shoe, beneath the dangling blanket.

As you pulled yourself up, you were met with even more surprise. A strange smell...faint whiffs of sweat and foot odor...oh my gosh, did the inside of these shoes stink? It wasn't a strong or overwhelming scent, these shoes weren't worn that much...but they were definitely worn enough to stink of sweat and feet still. It finally hit you, Ariana must actually use these shoes to work out.

As much as you idolize and adore her, had you known these were Ari's actual running shoes you wouldn't have risked coming over here. It takes your idol down a peg when you're forced to breathe in the scent of their sweaty feet. Gross.

Oh well, if you can just get up on the couch you can be free of Ariana's smelly shoes. You pull yourself all the way up and stand on the rim of the mouth. It's not great footing, and the blanket seems like a bit of a reach. You definitely don't want to fall! But you have to try, you stretch your hand out, and reach for the blanket while trying to maintain your balance.

What happens?
1553321123.title: Ariana's Tennis Shoes

15533211231.content:
Your hands wrap around a dangling thread from the blanket just as your feet slip and you lose your footing. Below you is the cavernous opening to Ariana's running shoe and the only thing preventing you from plummeting into the stinky depths of the pop star's footwear is your own upper body strength.

You were never the most athletic, but you held your own in gym class. You at least did your best to remain mildly fit and not too sedentary, and today that bit of effort finally paid off for certain. With great effort, you reached up further, grabbed a handful of blanket, and hoisted yourself, one handful at a time, pulling yourself higher and further away from the terrible fate of falling.

The strain was getting to you before you made it to safety, though. You were becoming exhausted, your muscles beginning to scream with the effort. info.brief_description: If you thought Atlas City was big before, just wait until you shrink. (Original Setting)
info.description:
Important Note: This city is a custom, original setting. It is not a reference to any book/movie/TV show. It's simply meant to be a sandbox setting for any number of stories.

You are Nick Lewis. You are 17 years old, you attend Hyperion High School, and you are a pretty normal guy. You have a decent amount of friends, you're kinda popular, but not too much, you're actually pretty smart with decent grades, but you're not the best of the best or anything.

This story will include a variety of venues in Atlas City, including your home, your high school, the park, and the beach, just to name a few. The goal is to provide a set character and other important cast, to cut down on choice chapters, but still allow a lot of settings.

Rules:

1. Try your best with your writing. If your chapter is unsalvageable I may have to delete it. If you are unsure about your writing and would like some help or if you notice you've made any errors that you'd like to fix after the fact, feel free to message me.

2. Try to stick to second person perspective for all of Nick's chapters ("You ran into your hiding space."). You are allowed to do perspective shifts, but if you do, preferably stick to third person for those.

3. Please no chapters that only have one choice, unless of course it's the end of a storyline. I don't want to see any chapters where the only choice is "Continue."

4. Nick Lewis is pretty vanilla and isn't harboring secret fetishes. He is not a closet macrophile or foot fetishist or anything like that.

5. Feel free to be kind of vague about Nick's size. It's okay if it doesn't always match up. Down the line, size changing can be allowed if you introduce it into the story organically.

6. You may also feel free to be just as vague about his durability.


Content: There is an 18+ tag. I'm fine with most things. Preferably no scat.

That's about all I've got. If I update this page, I will make edit notes at the bottom.

Enjoy reading the story, and a special thank you to anyone brave enough to add to it. We all appreciate our writers that keep these interactives interesting.
